title: Onion-Crusted Chicken

instructions.text: Cut onion into think julienne strips. Soak in milk for 5 minutes.
Combine flour, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, and salt in a bowl. Add some onions and toss to coat. Remove and repeat with remaining onions.
Heat oil in a large skillet or deep fryer. Fry onions in batches, stirring as needed, until browned (~2-3 minutes). Drain on paper towels and optionally season with salt.
Beat eggs in a bowl. Combine bread crumbs and at least 1/3 of onions in a small, flat container for coating. Remaining onions make a great snack.
Dip chicken breast in eggs, then press into bread crumb and onion mixture to coat it. Arrange on baking sheet and bake 20 minutes or until chicken is fully cooked.

notes: I saw a lot of breaded chicken recipes involving pre-made french onions. But homemade is always so much better.
